snippet: Even in Marseille, a city renowned for its tolerance, Muslims lament that when they are spoken of at all, they are referred to in divisive terms.
abstract: Marseille Journal; Muslims in Marseille, France, a city renowned for its tolerance, lament that when they are spoken of at all by presidential candidates, they are referred to as symbols of anxiety; candidates tend to use generalities, which many Muslims feel do not address their concerns.
lead_paragraph: Even in Marseille, a city renowned for its tolerance, Muslims lament that when they are spoken of at all, they are referred to in divisive terms.

headline.seo: Presidential Race in France Leaves Muslims Feeling Left Behind
headline.main: A Presidential Race Leaves French Muslims Feeling Like Outsiders
headline.print_headline: A Presidential Race Leaves French Muslims Feeling Like Outsiders
